Go Weekly

‚ñ∂¬†¬†Russ Cox on Passing the Torch ‚Äî Former Go tech lead Russ Cox went on the Go Time podcast recently to talk about the process of stepping down and handing over the reins to new leader Austin Clements (who also makes an appearance, as well as Cherry Mui who took over some of Austin‚Äôs prior responsibilities). There‚Äôs more about the changes in this post by Russ, if you missed it. (It‚Äôs an hour long podcast, but there‚Äôs a full¬†transcript.)

Go Time Podcast podcast

'When I Told 4,091 Writers They Weren‚Äôt Getting Paid..' ‚Äî An engineer over at the annoying paywall popular writing platform shares the unfortunate tale of a subtle bug / race condition that led to a lot of writers recieving unnecessary bad news. It‚Äôs worth reading about situations like this, as they can creep up in all sorts of¬†places.

Jacob Bennett (Medium)

Run GitHub Actions Up to 2x Faster at Half the¬†Cost ‚Äî Blacksmith runs your GitHub Actions substantially faster by running them on modern gaming CPUs. Integrating Blacksmith is a one-line code change. 100+ companies like Ashby, Superblocks, and Slope use Blacksmith to help developers merge code¬†faster.

Blacksmith sponsor

Gomponents 1.0: HTML View Components in Pure Go ‚Äî We first linked to this over three years ago, and it‚Äôs not only going strong, it‚Äôs hit v1.0. Now a stable, dependency-free HTML component library for your Go projects (there‚Äôs also an example app to look¬†through).

Markus W√ºstenberg

IN BRIEF:

  • David Mytton shares some lessons from running WebAssembly in production with Go and the Wazero runtime.

  • x = ?: I think we need a Go version of this Haskell-oriented dictionary of single letter variable names!

  • equ is a simple, Go-powered mathematical equation editor built on top of the recent released Tk 9.0 bindings for Go.

üì∫ How to Work with the GitHub API from Go ‚Äì A 22-minute screencast largely focused on getting¬†authenticated. package main

üìÑ CPU Throttling for Containerized Go Apps Explained ‚Äì A gotcha that ‚Äúcan have major¬†consequences.‚Äù Kanishk Singh

üõ† Code & Tools

Go Blueprint: Create New Go Projects with a Defined Structure ‚Äî One of an increasing number of tools (GoForge is another) for spinning up a new Go project with a pre-defined file structure and some code generation. This one lets you spin up an app based on Chi, Gin, Fiber, or other frameworks, as well as database support, and optional tooling like HTMX and Tailwind¬†CSS. GitHub repo.

Melkey

Automate Complex Workflows Across Clouds & Data Platforms ‚Äî Kestra scales to millions of executions, automating workflows across AWS, GCP, Snowflake, and more‚Äîseamless and¬†reliable.

Kestra sponsor

Toxiproxy 2.10: A TCP Proxy to Simulate 'Chaotic' Network¬†Conditions ‚Äî A long standing Shopify project designed to stress your system‚Äôs reliability and failure handling when it comes to underlying network issues. Toxiproxy can add latency, limit bandwidth, or close connections after a certain amount of data is¬†transferred.

Shopify

GoToSocial 0.17.0: A Go-Powered ActivityPub Server ‚Äî ActivityPub is the standard behind open federated social networks such as Mastodon. This isn‚Äôt Mastodon but does offer some compatibility with its API so you can use Mastodon client apps with¬†it.

Super Serious Business

Greenmask: Postgres Data Masking and Obfuscation Tool ‚Äî A Go-powered utility for dumping a Postgres database and anonymizing the data in a deterministic way. GitHub¬†repo.

Greenmask

üì∞¬†Classifieds

ü§ñ RAG, AI & Permissions in Go and open source? Join our upcoming webinar to learn how you can manage RAG & authorization with¬†SpiceDB.

Go builds taking a while? Install RunsOn in your AWS account and get much faster GitHub Actions runners for 10x cheaper. 1-click¬†install.

üîì Unlock the power of state management! Discover how Temporal simplifies complex workflows in our comprehensive guide. Download¬†now!

„Äê

#‚Äã525 ‚Äî October 1, 2024

Unsub¬†¬†|¬†¬†Web¬†Version

Go Weekly

Prep: Compile-Time Function Evaluation for Go ‚Äî ‚ÄúBy using prep.Comptime, you can evaluate functions at build time, replacing them with their computed results. Just like comptime from Zig. Except it‚Äôs not.‚Äù It admits it‚Äôs ‚Äúpure blasphemy‚Äù, but you can‚Äôt deny it‚Äôs an interesting idea, though it has limitations and toolexec was not intended to support arbtirary source rewriting.

Mark / pijng

Some Go Web Dev Notes ‚Äî We‚Äôre always fans of Julia‚Äôs earnest and helpful but no-nonsense posts and this quick grab bag of thoughts, tips and observations is another good¬†one. She always opens our eyes to something¬†new.

Julia Evans

Reduce Your Data Streaming and Kafka Costs by 80+% ‚Äî Learn how WarpStream's zero disk, stateless architecture and BYOC model not only reduce Kafka costs by 80% or more, but makes data streaming easier and more secure. Sign up for a free WarpStream account and get $400 in credits that never¬†expire.

WarpStream sponsor

üìâ¬†A Guide to the Go Garbage Collector ‚Äî Not a new page ‚Äì it dates back to Go 1.19 ‚Äì but one I‚Äôd somehow not encountered before and acts as a living document explaining how Go‚Äôs garbage collection system works, complete with helpful interactive¬†diagrams.

Go Documentation

Joining Errors in Go ‚Äî A helpful look at two approaches: using multiple %ws, and errors.Join (as introduced in Go¬†1.20).

Paschalis Tsilias

Distributed Metrics in PHP with Go and Gob ‚Äî Gob is a Go package for efficiently encoding and decoding values between Go¬†apps.

Maurits van der Schee

  • dae 0.7.4 ‚Äì High-perf transparent proxy based on¬†eBPF.

„Äê

#‚Äã524 ‚Äî September 24, 2024

Unsub¬†¬†|¬†¬†Web¬†Version

Go Weekly

What's in an (Alias) Name? ‚Äî Generic alias types are coming to Go 1.24 (expected in February 2025) in line with this proposal, building on both type aliases and generics. A major use case for type aliases is the ability to refactor without breaking compatibility. Robert explains the basics of type aliases and why bringing them to generics required extra¬†work.

Robert Griesemer

Stuck on What to Build? Guided Learning with Real¬†Projects ‚Äî Todo apps are for AI. Build a real-life project and master advanced backend patterns. Code hands-on in your IDE, no videos. Over 800 devs have joined us to create asynchronous event-driven software that solves real problems. Next cohort starts¬†soon.

Three Dots Labs sponsor

Sets in Go: Using Maps and Recommended Packages ‚Äî Go hasn‚Äôt got a native data type for sets, but maps can help you implement your own, as well as packages like golang-set. Willem shows us¬†how.

Willem Schots

Go's Singleflight Melts in Your Code, Not in Your DB ‚Äî The last post in a series on concurrency describes singleflight, a non-core package (that‚Äôs maintained by the Go team) that ensures a function is only run once and its result reused by later callers. There are loads of use cases, especially around database¬†access.

Phuong Le

IN BRIEF:

  • Giving Go a Go offers up little most Gophers don't already know, but it‚Äôs nice to see Go getting some love in Communications of the¬†ACM.

  • It's not only the ACM, WIRED Magazine has picked up on the Go rush too with Attention, Spoiled Software Engineers: Take a Lesson from Google‚Äôs Programming Language.

Developing a Go Bot That Embeds Ichiban Prolog ‚Äî Ichiban Prolog is a Go-powered implementation of the Prolog logic programming language and opens up the power of the language directly within Go apps. Here‚Äôs one specific use¬†case.

Roger Sen

Register Allocation in the Go Compiler ‚Äî Vladimir maintains GCC‚Äôs register allocator system and struggled to find docs on how Go does it, so he went diving into Go‚Äôs source code. This is deep stuff, but long story short, he likes Go‚Äôs approach: ‚Äúthe current Go RA is a well-designed and creative¬†RA.‚Äù

Vladimir Makarov (Red Hat)

üõ† Code & Tools

Revive 1.4: A Faster, Configurable, Flexible Linter for Go ‚Äî A drop-in replacement of golint that aims to provide a little more structure, configurability, and performance. It‚Äôs used by numerous large Go projects and libraries. GitHub¬†repo.

Minko Gechev

Counterfeiter: Generate Self-Contained, Type-Safe Test Doubles ‚Äî More quickly generate fake implementations of an object‚Äôs¬†collaborators.

Max Brunsfeld

Streamline Your Product Delivery with monday dev ‚Äî From ideation to launch, monday dev makes product delivery faster and simpler, all in one¬†place.

monday dev sponsor

Rueidis: A Fast Redis Client with Caching and More ‚Äî A Redis client focused on performance, supporting auto-pipelining of non blocking commands, client-side caching implemented the official way, and support for Redis‚Äôs many official extensions. Being hosted under Redis‚Äô official GitHub org is also quite the¬†endorsement.

Rueian

caddy-exec: Caddy Module for Running One-Off Commands ‚Äî Caddy is the fantastic Go-powered HTTP(S) server (we love it here) and this extension makes it possible to trigger commands either during startup/shutdown or via a¬†route.

Abiola Ibrahim

go2type: A Go to TypeScript API Client Generator ‚Äî Simple CLI tool that generates types and queries for frontends for Go¬†backends.

dx314

üì∞¬†Classifieds

üí∞ Dragonfly (25k GitHub stars) is a modern Redis replacement. Organizations that switch to Dragonfly can reduce infrastructure costs by¬†80%.

üõ†Ô∏è NewDevTools is a simple, daily update of new developer tools and services.

  • üëÄ GoCV 0.38.0 ‚Äì Bindings for the OpenCV computer vision library.

  • MongoDB Go Driver 1.17 ‚Äì The official Go driver for¬†MongoDB adds support for client authentication using OpenID¬†Connect.

  • Buf 1.42 ‚Äì CLI tool for working with Protocol¬†Buffers. A big update introducing the ability to author custom lint and breaking change rules added with¬†plugins.

  • automaxprocs 1.6 ‚Äì Automatically set GOMAXPROCS to match Linux container CPU quota.

  • River 0.12 ‚Äì Fast and reliable Postgres-powered background jobs for¬†Go.

  • Goyave 5.3 ‚Äì Enterprise REST API¬†framework.

item.title: „ÄêMicrosoft goes Go for SQL Server's CLI„ÄëÂæÆËΩØËΩ¨Âêë SQL Server ÁöÑ CLI
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã526 ‚Äî October 8, 2024

Unsub¬†¬†|¬†¬†Web¬†Version

Go Weekly

Reflecting on Go Reflection ‚Äî Truly a reflective opinion piece, and probably a divisive one too. As a programmer who chooses to use ‚Äúthe most mundane features‚Äù of any language, Go‚Äôs reflect package wasn‚Äôt on Neil‚Äôs list of things to try, but he ‚Äúfell into the reflection pool‚Äù and.. he‚Äôs still not a¬†fan.

Neil Macneale

I'm Glad I Did It in Go ‚Äî Thorsten, author of Writing an Interpreter in Go, reflects on how Go was the right language for the book, eight years¬†on.

Thorsten Ball

Elevate Your Backend Skills ‚Äî Whether it's Python, Go, TypeScript, or AWS, you can gain fundamental knowledge across multiple programming languages, expanding your skillset via our growing range of learning paths and expert-led video¬†courses.

Frontend Masters sponsor

sync.Map: The Right Tool for the Right Job ‚Äî The latest in Phuong‚Äôs popular, illustrated guide to concurrency options in Go digs into sync.Map, a concurrency-safe map for reading and writing across multiple goroutines without requiring explicit locks. It‚Äôs not always the perfect choice, though, as he¬†discovers.

Phuong Le

IN BRIEF:

  • ‚≠ê Microsoft has unveiled its new go-sqlcmd CLI app for SQL Server and Azure SQL and it's written in Go! Anna Hoffman ‚ñ∂Ô∏è quickly explains it¬†here.

  • Chris Siebenmann reflects on Go 1.22 and 1.23's new 'small language features' and how they make life easier.

  • Go 1.23.2 and 1.22.8 were released.

Go Gets High-Resolution Timers on Windows ‚Äî ‚ÄúThe Go Windows port added support for high-resolution timers in Go 1.23, boosting resolution from ~15.6ms to ~0.5ms.‚Äù

Quim Muntal (Microsoft)

Writing a Circuit Breaker in Go ‚Äî When you need a mechanism to stop a failing operation being tried over and over, a circuit breaker provides a graceful way to detect failures and recover from them with a cooldown¬†period.

Redowan Delowar

Using Go Embed ‚Äî The go:embed directive, around since Go 1.16, allows you to embed static files into your binary.

Matt Boyle

Distributed Transactions in Go: Read Before You Try ‚Äî How to approach transactions that need to span more than one¬†service.

Mi≈Çosz Sm√≥≈Çka

Product for Engineers: A Newsletter Helping Flex Your Product¬†Muscle ‚Äî Product for Engineers details the skills and strategies product engineers need to¬†succeed.

PostHog sponsor

üìÑ Implementing OpenSSL-Backed Go Cryptographic Algorithms Derek Parker (Red Hat)

üìÑ Some Notes on Upgrading Hugo ‚Äì Hugo is a popular Go-based static site¬†generator. Julia Evans

üìÑ Securing gRPC Services with JWT Authentication in Go Chris Shepherd

üõ† Code & Tools

Kamal 2: Thou Need Not PaaS ‚Äî Kamal is a container-based deployment tool from 37Signals, best known for their work on Ruby on Rails. It‚Äôs language agnostic though, and ‚ñ∂Ô∏è the screencast demo shows off deploying a simple Go app quickly, before moving on to a Ruby example. Certainly a viable new deployment option for Go apps on self-managed¬†servers.

David Heinemeier Hansson

Sidekick: Bare Metal to Production Ready in Minutes ‚Äî I haven‚Äôt tried this yet, but am itching to do so ASAP. Sidekick aims to give you a Fly.io-style single command deployment process out of the box for any VPS you have to hand. Inspired by Kamal (above) but is written in¬†Go.

Mahmoud Mousa

üì∞¬†Classifieds

Hookdeck: Stripe-level DX for all your¬†webhooks.

Learn how to build fine-grained authorization for your Go application using open-source software, directly from the founders and team behind¬†SpiceDB.

go-pretty: Pretty Print Tables, Lists and Text on the Terminal ‚Äî Utilities to prettify console output of tables, lists, progress-bars, text, etc. with a heavy emphasis on¬†customization.

Naveen Mahalingam

Giu 0.9: A Dear ImGui-Based Cross Platform GUI Framework ‚Äî Create GUI apps in Go on top of the Dear ImGui GUI library. v0.9 isn‚Äôt a big release but fleshes out the framework‚Äôs features and adds more¬†documentation.

Allen Dang

Watermill: Library for Building Event-Driven Apps ‚Äî A library for working with message streams (over numerous channels like Kafka, RabbitMQ, HTTP or even MySQL binlogs) to build event driven¬†apps.

Three Dots Labs

xmlquery: An XPath Library for Querying XML Documents ‚Äî For plucking out all elements with certain names or attributes, say.

antchfx

  • tk 9.0 ‚Äì CGo-free cross platform GUI toolkit for Go, a la Tkinter.

  • River 0.13 ‚Äì Fast and reliable Postgres-powered background jobs for¬†Go.

  • OSV-Scanner 1.9 ‚Äì Dependency vulnerability¬†scanner.

  • go-github 66.0 ‚Äì Client library for the GitHub v3¬†API.

  • Git Town 16.4 ‚Äì Git branch management¬†tool.

  • Ebiten 2.8.1 ‚Äì Go's simple 2D game¬†engine.
